intro: Chrysopsis nitidula, commonly known as the silverleaf goldeneye, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silvery-gray foliage with a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, adding a striking contrast to its metallic-green leaves. Chrysopsis nitidula is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun, making it a resilient species in dry landscapes.
